intro: Thoreldora cochinchinensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese tree frog plant, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Piperaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and small, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
